data.title: Living in Vacationland: 10 things happening near you this weekend
data.meta_description: Make the most out of your weekend with Spectrum News Maine.
data.text:
At Spectrum News Maine, we want to be your community connection. Whether you are a local or just visiting Maine, thereâs sure to be something to do near you â itâs âVacationlandâ after all.

If you like skiing or snowboarding, this weekend is for you. Across the state, Maineâs premier ski resorts are celebrating the spring season in typical Northeast fashion with concerts, aprÃ©s drinks and pond skimming. If youâre not a snow bunny, no problem. Weâre sure to have an event for you:

Friday

34th Annual Sugarloaf Reggae Fest

Friday-Sunday at Sugarloaf Mountain in Carrabassett Valley

Itâs reggae weekend at the Loaf and you donât want to miss this yearâs celebration. With outside concerts and non-stop parties, itâs a jammed-packed weekend at the Carrabassett Valley ski resort. The lineup includes Easy Star All Stars, Root Shock and Soul Rebel Project, among others. You must be 21 or older and have a concert ticket or an all-access pass to attend Friday and Saturday night shows. Get yours today on Eventbrite.

Portland Chamber Music Festival: Brentano String Quartet

7:30 p.m. at USMâs Hannaford Hall in Portland

Reggae music not your thing? Enjoy an evening of classical music by the Brentano String Quartet as the group kicks off the Portland Chamberâs 30th anniversary season. The group consists of violins, viola and cello. For more information or to purchase concert tickets, click here.

Saturday

Pond-A-Palooza

11 a.m. at Sunday River in Newry

The bigger the splash, the better the prize. Head to Sunday River this weekend for some springtime pond skimming. Registration is free at the welcome center at the South Ridge Lodge between 9 and 10:30 a.m. All kids under 18 need an adult to sign their liability form to compete. Costumes weigh heavily on your score, so suit up in anything but a wetsuit, unless, of course, youâre a wimp. Prizes go to the winner of the biggest splash. For more information, click here. Lift tickets can be purchased online in advance on the resortâs website.

2nd Annual Spring Bash

9 a.m.-5 p.m. at Saddleback Mountain in Rangeley

Throw on your best retro attire for a chance to win prizes from New Belgium Brewing and Fruit Smash Hard Seltzer. At noon, there will be a pond skimming contest on Wheeler Slope, followed by a live concert with fan-favorite Motor Booty Affair. Donât forget to stop by the Fruit Smash tent to spin the prize wheel and win a free beverage token and other swag. Those 21 and older must show their wristband to participate. For event details and to buy your lift tickets, click here.

Beers With(out) Beards

11 a.m.-10 p.m. at Brick South in Portland

Celebrate the women behind your favorite brews this weekend during this hop culture event. Honoring women in the beer industry, there will be over 60 women-led breweries in attendance. For more information and directions to Brick South, click here.

Fly Tying

1-4 p.m. at the Eastport Arts Center

Learn the traditional craft of fly tying during this hands-on workshop hosted by registered Maine guide and co-founder of the Maine Outdoor School, Joe Horn. Already know how to tie a fly? Event organizers say even veteran tyers will learn new techniques and skills. Each participant will have enough time to make around six flies. The session is for those 12 and up. The $30 registration fee covers all materials and instruction. To register, email Alison Brennan at alison@eastportartscenter.org. For event information, click here.

Grease

2:40 p.m. at The Colonial Theater in Belfast

Itâs automatic, itâs systematic, itâs hydromatic â why, itâs Greased Lightning!

Get ready to sing along with John Travolta and Olivia Newton-John during The Colonial Theaterâs showing of the iconic film, âGrease.â Grab your leather jacket or poodle skirt and a bucket of popcorn and get ready to be transported back to high school in the 1950s. Movie tickets can be purchased at the counter. For more information and additional showtimes, click here.

Maine Photography Show

4-6 p.m. at the Boothbay Region Art Foundation in Boothbay Harbor

Take a drive along the midcoast this weekend and spend an afternoon browsing the gallery at the Boothbay Region Art Foundation. Featuring both professional and amateur photographers from across the state, the show has four categories; black and white, color, special annual theme and student. For more information, click here.

This is a recurring event, with the exhibition open Thursdays through Sundays, from 11 a.m. to 5 p.m., through May 6.

The Mallett Brothers Band

7:30-9:30 p.m. at the Chocolate Church Arts Center in Bath

If you like alt-country, Americana, or roots and rock, make sure to purchase your tickets to see The Mallett Brothers Band in concert â you wonât be disappointed. The Maine-based group is a melting pot of sounds that are sure to get you moving and grooving. Tickets start at $25 and can be purchased on the centerâs website.

I saw the Mallett Brothers Band in concert and it was one of the best shows Iâve ever seen. Click the player below to listen to the bandâs top tracks on Spotify.

Sunday

Drag Brunch

11 a.m. at Ri Ra Irish Pub in Portland

Did someone say mimosa bar? Head to Ri Raâs for a drag brunch hosted by Cherry Lemonade and GiGi Gabor. There will be a full brunch buffet and, of course, an unlimited mimosa bar. Tickets are $60 and can be purchased in advance on Resy.
